title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: library(survSAKK) library(survival)

title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: veteran <- survival::veteran veteran$time_yr <- veteran$time/365.25 veteran$time_mt <- veteran$time_yr*12  # Define the reference arm veteran$trt <- factor(veteran$trt,                       levels = c(1,2),                       labels = c("Standard","Test"))  # Create survival object veteran_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time_yr, status) ~ 1, data = veteran) veteran_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time_mt, status) ~ 1, data = veteran) veteran_trt_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time_yr, status) ~ trt, data = veteran) veteran_trt_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time_mt, status) ~ trt, data = veteran)

title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: survSAKK::surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr)

title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_mt,           col = c("darkblue", "black"),           main = "Veterans' Administration Lung Cancer study",            xlab = "Time (months)",            legend.name = c("Standard","Test"))

previous_headings: Examples of ‘surv.plot’ Function > Drawing segment for specific timepoint/quantile
title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_mt,           col = c("darkblue", "black"),           xlab = "Time (months)",            legend.name = c("Standard","Test"),           segment.quantile = 0.5)

previous_headings: Examples of ‘surv.plot’ Function > Drawing segment for specific timepoint/quantile
title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_mt,           col = c("darkblue", "black"),           xlab = "Time (months)",            legend.name = c("Standard","Test"),           segment.timepoint = c(6))

previous_headings: Examples of ‘surv.plot’ Function > Drawing segment for specific timepoint/quantile
what: Estimated survival probability at 3,6 and 9 month
title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_mt,           segment.timepoint = c(3,6,9),           segment.annotation = "none",           segment.type = 2,           segment.col = "darkblue")

title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_mt,           segment.quantile =  0.5,           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomleft")

previous_headings: Examples of ‘surv.plot’ Function > Modify risk table
title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_mt,           segment.quantile =  0.5,           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomleft",           risktable = FALSE)

previous_headings: Examples of ‘surv.plot’ Function > Modify risk table
title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_mt,           col = c("darkblue","black"),           legend.name = c("Standard", "Test"),           segment.quantile =  0.5,           segment.annotation = c(17,0.9),           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomleft",           risktable.col = c("darkblue","black"),           risktable.title.font = 1,           risktable.name.font = 2)

title: survSAKK::surv.plot
code: par(mfrow=c(2,3)) # Plot 5 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_mt,           risktable = FALSE,           xlim = seq(0,34, by = 3),           xlab = ("Time (month)"),           segment.type = 3,           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation.space = 0.06,           segment.cex = 0.6,           risktable.cex = 0.4,           risktable.name.position = -4) # Plot 6 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,           risktable = TRUE,           xlim = seq(0,3, by = 0.5),           xlab = c("Time (year)"),           ylab = c("Survival"),           main = "Kaplan-Meier Pots",           legend.name = c("Veterans"),           legend.cex = 0.6,           segment.type = 3,           segment.timepoint = 1.0,           segment.annotation.space = 0.06,           segment.annotation = c(1.58,0.75),           segment.cex = 0.6,           segment.col = "darkred",           risktable.cex = 0.4,           risktable.title.position = -0.5,           risktable.name.position = -0.5) # Plot 7 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_mt,           risktable = TRUE,           legend.name = c("LT60","OV60"),           legend.position = c(23.7,0.3),           legend.cex = 0.6,           xlim = seq(0,34, by = 6),           xlab = ("Time (month)"),           segment.timepoint = 6,           segment.annotation.space = 0.06,           segment.main = "Survival at 6mt [95%]",           segment.annotation = c(18, 0.85),           segment.cex = 0.6,           segment.col = c("#666666","#a6761d"),           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomleft",           stat.font = 2,           stat.cex = 0.6,           risktable.cex = 0.5)  # Plot 8 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_mt,           risktable = TRUE,           grid =FALSE,           col = c("pink","lightblue"),           xlab = "Time (year)",           xlim = seq(0,3),           legend.title = "Treatment Regimens",           legend.title.cex = 0.5,           legend.name = c("LT60","OV60"),           legend.cex = 0.6,           stat = "coxmodel",           stat.position = "bottomleft",           stat.cex = 0.6,           risktable.cex = 0.5 )  # Plot 9 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_mt,           risktable = TRUE,           grid =TRUE,           col = c("#5ab4ac","#d8b365"),           xlab = "Time (year)",           xlim = seq(0,3, by = 0.25),           legend.title = "Treatment Regimens",           legend.title.cex = 0.5,           legend.name = c("LT60","OV60"),           legend.cex = 0.6,           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomleft",           stat.cex = 0.6,           risktable.cex = 0.5,           risktable.col = c("#5ab4ac","#d8b365"),           risktable.name.font = 4 )  # Plot 10 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_mt,           risktable = FALSE,           grid =TRUE,           col = c("#fc8d59","#99d594"),           xlab = "Time (year)",           xlim = seq(0,3),           legend.title = "Treatment Regimens",           legend.title.cex = 0.5,           legend.name = c("LT60","OV60"),           legend.cex = 0.6,           segment.type = 1,           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation = "left",           segment.annotation.space = 0.04,           segment.cex = 0.5,           segment.font = 2,           stat = "logrank",           stat.position = "bottomleft",           stat.cex = 0.6,           risktable.cex = 0.5,           risktable.title = "No. at risk",           risktable.title.font = 2) par(mfrow=c(1,1))

title: survSAKK
text: package survSAKK provides publicaiton ready Kaplan-Meier Plots developed SAKK CC.https://www.sakk.ch/en.

title: survSAKK
code: devtools::install_github(   repo = "https://github.com/SAKK-Statistics/survSAKK",   build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: survSAKK
code: libray(survSAKK)

what: Get the documentation of a function
title: survSAKK
code: ?survSAKK

code: vignette(survSAKK)

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
text: goal survSAKK create open source, user-friendly flexible R package, incorporate various statistics layout customization options enhance efficiency adaptability Kaplan-Meier plot.

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
text: can install development version survSAKK GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("SAKK-Statistics/survSAKK", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
code: library(survSAKK) ## basic example code

what: Get the documentation of the funciton

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Plot — surv.plot
text: Plot publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot using results survival::survfit().

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Plot — surv.plot
code: surv.plot(   fit,   mark.censoring = TRUE,   conf.int = fit$conf.int,   conf.band = TRUE,   conf.band.col = col,   conf.band.alpha = 0.25,   conf.type = "log-log",   grid = FALSE,   col = NULL,   main = NULL,   sub = NULL,   xlab = "Time",   ylab = "Estimates Survival Probability",   cex.lab = 1,   cex.axis = 0.6,   bty = "l",   lty = c("solid", "dotted", "dotted"),   lwd = 1,   xlim = seq(from = 0, to = ceiling(max(fit$time)) + ceiling(min(fit$time))),   ylim = seq(from = 0, to = 1, by = 0.25),   show.legend = TRUE,   legend.position = "topright",   legend.name = NULL,   legend.text.font = 1,   legend.cex = 0.6,   legend.title = NULL,   legend.title.cex = 1,   segment.type = 3,   segment.timepoint = NULL,   segment.quantile = NULL,   segment.main = NULL,   segment.annotation = "right",   segment.col = "#666666",   segment.annotation.col = col,   segment.lty = "dashed",   segment.lwd = 1,   segment.cex = 0.6,   segment.annotation.space = 0.03,   segment.font = 1,   segment.main.font = 1,   stat = "none",   stat.position = "right",   stat.col = "black",   stat.cex = 0.75,   stat.font = 1,   risktable = TRUE,   risktable.title = "Number at risk",   risktable.title.font = 3,   risktable.title.col = "black",   risktable.title.position = par("usr")[1] - (par("usr")[2] - par("usr")[1]) * 0.1,   risktable.cex = 0.5,   risktable.col = "black",   risktable.name.font = 2,   risktable.name.col = "#666666",   risktable.name.position = par("usr")[1] - (par("usr")[2] - par("usr")[1]) * 0.1 )

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Plot — surv.plot
text: fit object class survfit containing survival data. mark.censoring Mark censoring events curves. Logical (default: TRUE) conf.int Display confidence intervals. (FALSE, TRUE 95% confidence intervals, specify numeric value desired coverage. conf.band Mapping specified coverage probability conf.band.col Colour(s) confidence band. Can accept single value colour, vector colour values. conf.band.alpha Transparency confidence band. conf.type Transformation type confidence interval.Options: "log", "log-log", "plain", "logit", "arcsin";(default: "log-log"). grid Draw grid plot Logical (default: FALSE) col Colour(s) survival curves. Can accept single value colour, vector colour values set colour(s). main Title plot. sub Subtitle plot. xlab X-axis label. ylab Y-axis label. cex.lab numeric value specifying size xlab ylab text. cex.axis numeric value specifying size axis size. bty type box drawn around plot ("n","o","7","L","C","U") lty vector string specifying line types curve (“blank”, “solid”, “dashed”, “dotted”, “dotdash”, “longdash”, “twodash”). lwd vector numeric values line widths. xlim X-axis limits specified sequence; seq(starting value,  end value, number increment sequence). ylim Y-axis limits specified sequence; seq(starting value,  end value, number increment sequence). show.legend Display legend. legend.position Position legend (c(x,y), "bottomright", "bottom", "bottomleft", "left", "topleft", "top", "topright", "right" "center"). legend.name vector string specifying name(s) stratum. legend.text.font integer specifying font style legend text; (1: normal, 2: bold, 3: italic, 4: bold italic). legend.cex Expansion factor legend text. legend.title title legend. legend.title.cex Expansion factor legend title. segment.type numeric value specifying layout segment (1: Draws specified segment (full bandwidth), 2: Draws specified segment, 3: Drawing vertical horizontal segment). segment.timepoint single value vector fixed time points segment(s). segment.quantile single value vector fixed quantile segment(s) fixed quantile (e.g. 0.5 corresponds median). segment.main Title segment text. segment.annotation Position segment annotation: (c(x,y), "bottomleft", "left", "right", "none"). segment.col Can accept single value colour, vector colour values set colour(s). segment.annotation.col Can accept single value colour, vector colour values set colour(s). segment.lty vector string specifying line types curve (“blank”, “solid”, “dashed”, “dotted”, “dotdash”, “longdash”, “twodash”). segment.lwd vector numeric values line widths. segment.cex numeric values specifying size segment annotation size. segment.annotation.space Spacing text unit x-coordinates. segment.font numeric value specifying font face (1 = plain, 2 = bold, 3 = italic, 4 = bold-italic, ...). segment.main.font numeric value specifying fon face (1 = plain, 2 = bold, 3 = italic, 4 = bold-italic, ...). stat Statistics displayed plot ("logrank", "coxph", "coxmodel", "none"). stat.position Position stat displayed: (c(x,y), "bottomleft", "left", "right", "none"). stat.col Can accept single value colour. stat.cex numeric value specifying size stat size. stat.font font face (1 = plain, 2 = bold, 3 = italic, 4 = bold-italic). risktable logical value drawing risk table (Default: TRUE). risktable.title Title risk table. risktable.title.font Title font risk table (1 = normal, 2 = bold, 3 = italic, 4 = bold italic). risktable.title.col Colour risk table title. Can accept single value colour. risktable.title.position Position title x-axis. risktable.cex numeric value specifying size risk table size. risktable.col Colour(s) risk table. Can accept single value colour, vector colour values set colour(s). risktable.name.font legend name(s) font risk table (1 = normal, 2 = bold, 3 = italic, 4 = bold italic). risktable.name.col Colour risk table name. Can accept single value colour. risktable.name.position Position legend name(s) x-axis.

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Plot — surv.plot
text: Publication-Ready Kaplan-Meier Plot incorporating various statistics layout customisation options enhance efficiency adaptability Kaplan-Meier plot.

title: Publication Ready Kaplan-Meier Plot — surv.plot
code: # Load Libraray  require(survival)  require(survSAKK)  # Load Data  veteran$time_yr <- veteran$time/365.25  veteran$time_mt <- veteran$time_yr*12  # Create survival object  veteran_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time_yr, status) ~ 1, data = veteran)  veteran_trt_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time_mt, status) ~ trt, data = veteran)  # Generate survival plots  par(mfrow=c(1,2))  survSAKK::surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,           risktable = FALSE,           xlim = seq(0,3, by = 0.5),           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation.space = 0.02) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'time_yr' not found   survSAKK::surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_mt,           col = c("#5ab4ac","#d8b365"),           legend.title = "Treatment Regimens",           legend.name = c("LT60","OV60"),           segment.timepoint = 1,           segment.col = "darkred",           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomleft",           risktable.col = c("#5ab4ac","#d8b365")) #> Error in eval(predvars, data, env): object 'time_mt' not found  par(mfrow=c(1,1))
